# Named lists

Create a named list using specified names or, if names are omitted,
using the names of the objects in the list. The code
`list(a = a, b = b)` becomes `nlist(a,b)` and `list(a = a, b = 2)`
becomes `nlist(a, b = 2)`, etc.

## Usage

``` r
nlist(...)
```

## Arguments

- ...:

  Objects to include in the list.

## Value

A named list.

## Examples

``` r
# All variables already defined
a <- rnorm(100)
b <- mat.or.vec(10, 3)
nlist(a,b)
#> $a
#>   [1]  0.46402132  0.18328496  0.37014325 -0.46539846 -1.35699064 -0.94756588
#>   [7] -1.32675628  1.71944404 -0.87898014 -0.02435987 -0.35046913 -1.49272159
#>  [13] -1.34795616 -0.87239734  0.36550662 -0.95172768 -0.20884901 -0.58875870
#>  [19] -0.71210362  2.55268532 -0.15015995  0.49893157  0.48499617 -0.46047212
#>  [25]  0.47671215  1.44219503 -0.53252713 -1.00355596 -0.79759812 -0.35212601
#>  [31] -0.12575206 -1.12890042  1.81283778  0.54590031  0.27614100 -1.78703622
#>  [37] -0.69897022  0.66958072  1.16590622 -0.10045622 -0.19541553  1.01477218
#>  [43] -0.29486217  1.95328836  0.22345390 -0.89055374 -0.21735722  0.64246743
#>  [49] -0.19687145 -0.92607721  1.18453783  0.68133067 -0.22411617 -0.42614768
#>  [55]  1.33986614 -0.72595917  0.54091251  0.71569348  0.08556613 -0.98998589
#>  [61]  0.27201072 -2.00633480 -2.45095243  0.04180641  1.27960696  0.32538273
#>  [67] -0.45765369  0.78471577 -0.03627547  1.09984716 -0.93415634  1.16878532
#>  [73]  0.71871116  0.68790149  0.28979210  0.69836408  1.10855493  0.27345095
#>  [79]  0.98693726 -0.58554379 -0.01686564  0.88033592 -0.50875613  0.33882608
#>  [85] -0.81332136  1.04149262  0.24335859 -0.64718064  0.61923141  0.89574032
#>  [91] -1.48522355 -1.14509293 -0.52444523 -0.37295246  1.25390995 -0.11286019
#>  [97] -0.22566170 -0.13817146  1.37191158 -1.54525644
#> 
#> $b
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#>  [1,]    0    0    0
#>  [2,]    0    0    0
#>  [3,]    0    0    0
#>  [4,]    0    0    0
#>  [5,]    0    0    0
#>  [6,]    0    0    0
#>  [7,]    0    0    0
#>  [8,]    0    0    0
#>  [9,]    0    0    0
#> [10,]    0    0    0
#> 

# Define some variables in the call and take the rest from the environment
nlist(a, b, veggies = c("lettuce", "spinach"), fruits = c("banana", "papaya"))
#> $a
#>   [1]  0.46402132  0.18328496  0.37014325 -0.46539846 -1.35699064 -0.94756588
#>   [7] -1.32675628  1.71944404 -0.87898014 -0.02435987 -0.35046913 -1.49272159
#>  [13] -1.34795616 -0.87239734  0.36550662 -0.95172768 -0.20884901 -0.58875870
#>  [19] -0.71210362  2.55268532 -0.15015995  0.49893157  0.48499617 -0.46047212
#>  [25]  0.47671215  1.44219503 -0.53252713 -1.00355596 -0.79759812 -0.35212601
#>  [31] -0.12575206 -1.12890042  1.81283778  0.54590031  0.27614100 -1.78703622
#>  [37] -0.69897022  0.66958072  1.16590622 -0.10045622 -0.19541553  1.01477218
#>  [43] -0.29486217  1.95328836  0.22345390 -0.89055374 -0.21735722  0.64246743
#>  [49] -0.19687145 -0.92607721  1.18453783  0.68133067 -0.22411617 -0.42614768
#>  [55]  1.33986614 -0.72595917  0.54091251  0.71569348  0.08556613 -0.98998589
#>  [61]  0.27201072 -2.00633480 -2.45095243  0.04180641  1.27960696  0.32538273
#>  [67] -0.45765369  0.78471577 -0.03627547  1.09984716 -0.93415634  1.16878532
#>  [73]  0.71871116  0.68790149  0.28979210  0.69836408  1.10855493  0.27345095
#>  [79]  0.98693726 -0.58554379 -0.01686564  0.88033592 -0.50875613  0.33882608
#>  [85] -0.81332136  1.04149262  0.24335859 -0.64718064  0.61923141  0.89574032
#>  [91] -1.48522355 -1.14509293 -0.52444523 -0.37295246  1.25390995 -0.11286019
#>  [97] -0.22566170 -0.13817146  1.37191158 -1.54525644
#> 
#> $b
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#>  [1,]    0    0    0
#>  [2,]    0    0    0
#>  [3,]    0    0    0
#>  [4,]    0    0    0
#>  [5,]    0    0    0
#>  [6,]    0    0    0
#>  [7,]    0    0    0
#>  [8,]    0    0    0
#>  [9,]    0    0    0
#> [10,]    0    0    0
#> 
#> $veggies
#> [1] "lettuce" "spinach"
#> 
#> $fruits
#> [1] "banana" "papaya"
#> 
```
